survey_brief: This survey aims to understand how public library usage has evolved post-pandemic, including changes in visitation frequency, preferred services, and digital resource adoption.

questions.question_text: How often do you visit your local public library in person since the pandemic restrictions were lifted?
questions.client_notes: Use a single-choice radio button for clarity. Ensure options cover all likely frequencies.

script.question_text: How often do you visit your local public library in person since the pandemic restrictions were lifted?

questions.question_text: Which of the following public library services have you used in the past year? (Select all that apply)
questions.client_notes: Use checkboxes (MULTI_CHOICE). Include an exhaustive list of common services.

script.question_text: Which of the following public library services have you used in the past year? (Select all that apply)

questions.question_text: What factors would encourage you to visit the library more frequently?
questions.client_notes: Include an 'Other' option with a text field for open-ended responses.
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: radio button with optional open-text (SINGLE_CHOICE).

script.question_text: What factors would encourage you to visit the library more frequently?

questions.question_text: How satisfied are you with your library's current digital resources (e.g., e-books, online databases)?
questions.routing_logic: Respondents who selected 'E-book/digital lending' in Q2
questions.client_notes: Use a Likert scale. Route only to users who have used digital services.

script.question_text: How satisfied are you with your library's current digital resources (e.g., e-books, online databases)?
script.routing_logic: Respondents who selected 'E-book/digital lending' in Q2

questions.question_text: What improvements would you suggest for your public library's services?
questions.client_notes: Open-ended question to capture qualitative feedback. Limit to 300 characters.

script.question_text: What improvements would you suggest for your public library's services?
